data.title: Problem matcher skips some matches when match for "info" severity is included in regex

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
This issues is in regards to the ```problemMatcher``` in ```tasks.json```. In some cases, adding a capture group for `severity` which includes info/note causes some regex matches to be ignored.

Consider the following regex which should match gcc/g++ compilation output:

```
"problemMatcher": {
	"owner": "cpp",
	"fileLocation": ["relative", "${workspaceRoot}"],
	"pattern": {
		"regexp": "^(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+):\\s+(?:.*)?\\s*(warning|error):\\s+(.*)",
		"file": 1,
		"line": 2,
		"column": 3,
		"severity": 4,
		"message": 5
	}
}
```

The above regex matches all warning and error messages. However, if I modify the regex to capture all "note" information, like so:

```
"regexp": "^(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+):\\s+(?:.*)?\\s*(warning|error|note):\\s+(.*)"
```

Then some of the error messages are skipped in the "Problems" window. This only happens when multiple files have errors matched by the regex.

Attached is a minimum repro for Windows 10 (with WSL) and Linux. Requires g++ 4.9.

[VSCodeWorkspace.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1090295/VSCodeWorkspace.zip)


This is *not* a bug with the C/C++ plugin; the plugin is merely being used to demonstrate the bug.

---

- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|;

data.title: ProblemMatcher cannot work with massive extra message ?
Menu Bar drop down fails on Debian 8 Linux

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Do you have a question? Please ask it on [Stack Overflow with `vscode` tag](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode)

(Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these)
- VSCode Version:  1:13:1
- OS Version: Linux Debain 8

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click Help
2. Move mouse to any menu item
Menu graphic changes to a black box with a circle.  All menu items are not visible.

Alternate work around is use the ctrl key combinations, but if none are available then the first letter of the sub menu item works for the first item only.  For example, Help, R gives you release notes.  Unable to reach Report Issues.
 
Interesting how the View menu item will allow you to move the mouse down to sub-menu options.

data.title: [json] support const keyword

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
JSON Schema includes a `const` keyword to indicate that a property must be a specific value (http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-validation.html#rfc.section.6.24).  VS Code does not report a problem if the property does not match the value.  (It _does_ work if you use an `enum` with a single value.)

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. See sample repo https://github.com/itowlson/vscode-json-schema-test and load the extension. Note the contents of schema/foo.schema.json.

2. Run this extension in the Extension Development Host (or create a new extension and add the jsonValidation section and foo.schema.json file from the sample repo).

3. In the Extension Development Host, open the file test/test.foo.json.

4. View the "apiVersion" element.  Expected: A warning squiggly, and hover message along the lines of "Value is not accepted. Valid value: ''2017-01-01.1.0'" (basing this on the enum message - I'm sure you can word it better).  Actual: no warning.

(The "apiVersionWorkaround" element works correctly - I included it only so you could compare the const behaviour to the single-value enum behaviour.)

---

- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|mdhelper|joshbax|0.0.9|;

data.title: Typings only picked up after renaming .spec.ts file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (77bf512f0eba6c7082f5b442ac5de585febcab23, 2017-06-19T08:59:44.265Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
jsrefactor|cms|1.2.0
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
tslint|eg2|0.15.0
PowerShell|ms-|1.3.2
java|red|0.6.0
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.1
gitblame|wad|1.11.3

(4 theme extensions excluded)


---

**Steps to Reproduce:**
I have a project setup with:
* typescript 2.3.4
* and typings for chai, mocha and sinon

It appears that the typings for mocha and sinon are only picked up after renaming my *app.spec.ts* file to *app.\<anything else than spec\>.ts.
The types seem to be picked up during compilation before running the test.

This issue is also present in VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)

![typings](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1196216/27362799-a002e968-55e5-11e7-82e6-33e1c53ac5f7.gif)

*package.json dependencies*
```
"devDependencies": {
    "awesome-typescript-loader": "^3.1.3",
    "chai": "^4.0.2",
    "istanbul-instrumenter-loader": "^2.0.0",
    "karma": "^1.7.0",
    "karma-chai": "^0.1.0",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "^2.1.1",
    "karma-coverage": "^1.1.1",
    "karma-mocha": "^1.3.0",
    "karma-phantomjs-launcher": "^1.0.4",
    "karma-sinon": "^1.0.5",
    "karma-sourcemap-loader": "^0.3.7",
    "karma-typescript": "^3.0.4",
    "karma-webpack": "^2.0.3",
    "mocha": "^3.4.2",
    "npm-run-all": "^4.0.2",
    "rimraf": "^2.6.1",
    "sinon": "^2.3.5",
    "typescript": "^2.3.4",
    "typings": "^2.1.1",
    "webpack": "^3.0.0",
    "webpack-config-utils": "^2.3.0",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^2.4.5"
  },
```

*typings.json*
```
{
    "globalDependencies": {
        "chai": "registry:dt/chai#3.4.0+20170217154556",
        "mocha": "registry:dt/mocha#2.2.5+20170311011848",
        "sinon": "registry:dt/sinon#1.16.1+20161208163514"
    }
}
```

*tsconfig.json*
```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "alwaysStrict": true,
        "target": "es5",
        "module": "commonjs"
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules",
        "**/*.spec.ts"
    ]
}
```

data.title: Makefile syntax highlight bug, improper function colorization in dependency list
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:
In this Makefile snippet's dependency list, if the variable $(T_AUX_MESSAGES_DRIVER_SRC) is put before the function call $(addprefix $(T_PROJ_SRC_DIR), $(...) $(...)), then "addprefix" is not properly colorized.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18319900/27361135-3895218e-55da-11e7-934b-f965f032f789.png)
If I change the order, "addprefix" colorization is fine.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18319900/27361182-92043a52-55da-11e7-81ff-a5e25696a2f2.png)
This bug might be present with other functions as well, like "patsubst", but I didn't try..

data.title: Ctrl+ Shortcut does not open Integrated Terminal - it increases font size
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Win 10 Home

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open new VS file.
2. Enter Text
3. Press Ctrl+ shortcut to open Integrated Terminal. (In my case, Powershell).
4. Obeserve your font size will increase, but does not open the Terminal.

Maybe change the shortcut command to :Ctrl Shft +
![terminal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4664200/27360862-c083b1f2-55f1-11e7-9e41-e977edecd94d.jpg)

data.title: Support custom snippets in new Emmet
data.body:
With  https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/ac60143aa971dd22a6887267f008b7336df39ab5 the `snippets.json` file from `emmet.extensionsPath` is now read and used by new emmet

But since the new emmet modules do not use old style snippets, only the `variables` section of the `snippets.json` file is used.

This issue is to track the possibility of having custom snippets in the new emmet as well

data.title: [WIP] Inline all decorations - attempt 3
data.body:
This is follow up on #20042 and #27218.
Original issue: #19749.

OK, so this time I've added separate implementation of Widget based on IViewZone only for new functionality, two new functions in controller handling this new functionality and one editor action. It's not touching old functionality at all.

I do have one small problem - both implementations  are setting left margin differently which is rather annoying.

data.title: Test: Sublime Text Keymap Version 3
data.body:
**Complexity:** 2

**OS:**
- [x] any - @alexandrudima 

**Background**
Version 3 update to the Sublime Text keymap changes settings for the users of the extension. We want to do this without disrupting their flow. 

**Tests**
1. Install the extension from the [vsix](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-sublime-keybindings/blob/master/sublime-keybindings-3.0.0.vsix)
2. Confirm the version three prompt shows 
3. Click Yes. Confirm that new settings are added. Try one of the settings to confirm it works as expected (ex. multi cursor with cmd or ctrl). 
4. Remove all the settings. Reload VS Code. 
5. See the prompt and click no. Confirm a setting indicating the prompt showed was added and that other settings were not added. 
6. Reload VS Code. Confirm the prompt does not show again.

data.title: Cannot open program by double-clicking icon
data.body:
Cannot load program by double-clicking on the program icon. Tried deleting the %USERPROFILE%\.vscode-insiders folder, and also the one under %APPDATA%. Only way I can open is by specifying a path or right-click and opening the folder in the program via the Explorer hook. Also cannot "Report Issues" as it gets a null error, "Cannot read property 'length' of undefined". Sometimes, it cannot open settings, and gives "Unable to open 'settings.json': Cannot read property 'getRoot' of null." Have also tried uninstall/reinstall twice. As far as I can tell, the non-Insiders build runs fine.

- VSCode Version: 1.14.0-Insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4079416/27358339-c240284c-55db-11e7-9c42-98ae7f97865b.PNG)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Double-click Program icon in Start Menu, or Desktop icon

data.body:
(Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these)
- VSCode Version: Latest
- OS Version: Latest

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the Git browser in a project with untracked files
2. Untracked files are listed and there's no option to hide them

I tried using `"git.countBadge": "tracked"` but this didn't seem to have any effect.

data.title: Git merge conflict feature doesn't recognize git diff3 common-ancestor sections
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|tsunami-code|derander|0.8.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|vscode-doiuse|mrmlnc|1.4.0|
|annotator|ryu1kn|0.10.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Turn on git's three-way conflict output: `git config --global merge.conflictstyle diff3`
2. Create a merge conflict.
3. View the conflicting file in VS Code.

The current feature sees the parent section (`||||||| merged common ancestors` and the following lines) as part of the "current change", as opposed to a separate version of the code. This means that e.g. "Accept current change" doesn't work as intended.

data.title: Perforce SCM Provider becomes active SCM Provider on install
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code on a project not under source control
2. Source Control View where you see SOURCE CONTROL: Git and Initialize Repository
3. More > Switch SCM Providers.. Install Additional SCM Providers...
4. Install Perforce for VS Code extension slevesque.perforce and Reload

Perforce is now the active SCM Provider. Maybe this is by design but shouldn't the user choose the active SCM provider.
If the project is already under Git source control and you install Perforce, the SCM Provider remains Git, which is good.

data.title: VSTS SCM Provider not shown on Switch SCM Provider
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.2
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code on a project without source control.
2. Source Control View where you see SOURCE CONTROL: Git and Initialize Repository
3. More > Switch SCM Providers..
4. Git is listed and checked.
5. Install Additional SCM Providers...
6. Install VSTS ms-vsts.team and Reload
7. More > Switch SCM Providers...

Only Git is shown, there is no entry for VSTS.
More does show the VSTS command "Associate Work Items" and you can see Team: commands in the Command Palette.

data.title: Add git stashing
data.body:
Addresses https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1904 which is one of the oldest and most upvoted issues.

Adds 3 new commands for git integration:
* `git stash`
* `git stash pop` using latest stash
* `git stash pop` with choosing stash

data.title: HTML - p tag inside a p tag
data.body:
Hi.
I'm using Visual Code daily, so I would want one issue to be handled. When writing an HTML code in some online text editors when I put a <p> tag inside another <p> tag, I get a reasonable syntax error indicating that it is not right, because we can't give any CSS properties (just can't style) that inner <p> tag. But maybe for some reasons it doesn't give any kind of snytax error when I type in Visual Code. So I think that it would be great if this issue was taken into account by Visual Code Developers. Hopefully, this will make You curious as it made me :)

Thanks.
Best regards.

data.title: Indentation Rule enhancement
data.body:
We can start with popular languages first and make sure new users have a good auto indent experience when they first try vanilla VS Code.

First of all, in VSCode, we will adjust indentation for `brackets` (which is defined in `languageConfiguration`). This works well for languages whose grammar is simple, e.g. CSS, JSON. However when you move lines or copy/paste, the brackets enhancement doesn't help. For these cases, indentation rules can help with it with ease, if they are written *correctly*.

* [x] CSS. Add two rules `increaseIndentPattern` and `decreaseIndentPattern`
* [x] JavaScript/TypeScript. We have both [onEnter rules](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/1564137/extensions/typescript/src/typescriptMain.ts#L293) and [four indentation rules](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/1564137/extensions/typescript/src/typescriptMain.ts#L285).
* [x] HTML. We have two basic [indentation rules](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/19ae093/extensions/html/client/src/htmlMain.ts#L81)
* [x] JSON. Add two rules `increaseIndentPattern` and `decreaseIndentPattern`
* [x] CPP
* [ ] CSharp
* [x] PHP
* [ ] Go
* [ ] Java
* [x] Ruby. [Increase, decrease rules](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/12e35df/extensions/ruby/language-configuration.json#L25)

data.title: Feature-Request: Case sensistive replacements
data.body:
If I have

`leagues := getLeagues()`, 

and I want to replace leagues with teams, I end up with 

`teams := getteams()`

instead of 

`teams := getTeams()`.

Basically, when replacing, have a toggle that can keep the "in-place" case of the replacement. JEdit does this very well, and it is extremely handy.

data.title: tsserver is locking files
data.body:
I'm developing a Meteor.js application. In the last week, I've been experiencing multiple errors (randomly: ENOTEMPTY, EPERM, EBUSY) during the building process of the app while Visual Code open.

The .meteor folder is included to the **files.exclude**; this is to prevent visual code to scan the files created by meteor during the building process (which would slow down the build process). But this does not seems to work as the code.exe process spikes up during the building process. 
I'm suspecting Visual Code scans the files that Meteor creates and manipulates which triggers the errors.

There are no error when Visual Code is closed.

My understanding is if a folder is marked as to be excluded (files.exclude), then Visual Code should not try to access those files. Please, correct me if I'm wrong.

Issue also referenced: 
#https://github.com/meteor/meteor/issues/8801
![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18633763/27351694-11f86648-55b3-11e7-99d3-338e58cca06a.jpg)


Any help would be appreciated.
